meanings.def: the hard outer part of eggs, nuts, some seeds, and some animals
examples: We collected shells on the beach.
snail/oyster/clam shells
walnut shells
earrings made out of coconut shell
the shell of a turtle
Male crabs shed their shells twice a year.
Remove the mussels from their shells.
The snail went back into its shell.
There was a hard outer shell and a tough inner shell.

meanings.def: any object that looks like the shell of a snail or sea creature
examples: pasta shells

meanings.def: a metal case filled with explosive, to be fired from a large gun
examples: mortar/artillery shells
A shell burst only yards away from us.
Several empty shell casings were found in the area.
Two shells hit the roof.
They braved heavy shell fire to rescue the wounded.
The telltale sound of an incoming shell was heard.
a heap of spent brass shells from a machine gun

meanings.def: a tube or case containing explosive and a bullet or shot, for shooting from a gun
the walls or outer structure of something, for example, an empty building or ship after a fire or a bomb attack
examples: The house was now a shell gutted by flames.
(figurative) My life has been an empty shell since he died.
The fire reduced the school to a hollow shell.

meanings.def: any structure that forms a hard outer frame
examples: the body shell of a car

meanings.def: the outer layer of somebody’s personality; how they seem to be or feel
examples: She had developed a shell of indifference.
She had built up a protective shell around herself.

meanings.def: to become less shy and more confident when talking to other people
examples: He’s really come out of his shell since he met Marie.

meanings.def: to become shyer and avoid talking to other people
examples: Whenever my friends are here, she just withdraws into her shell.

idioms.def: to become less shy and more confident when talking to other people
examples: He’s really come out of his shell since he met Marie.

idioms.idiom: to go, retreat, etc. into your shell
idioms.def: to become shyer and avoid talking to other people
examples: Whenever my friends are here, she just withdraws into her shell.
They shelled the city all night.
Just as they were leaving, the rebels started shelling.

meanings.def: to remove the shell or outer layer from nuts, peas, etc.

a large international oil company that was formed when the British company Shell combined with the Dutch company Royal Dutch in the 1900s. It is now involved in producing oil and gas in Asia, the Middle East, the North Sea and South America. It also owns petrol stations in many countries.
